tool.name: topn
tool.description: Get the top (n) peaks in selected retention time windows of an LC-MS experiment
tool.command: topn.R --sample_metadata=$sample_metadata --out_dir=. --cores=\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4} --galaxy_files=' #for $i in $input $i, #end for ' --files=' #for $i in $input $i.name, #end for ' #if $time_windows_cond.time_windows_choice== 'choose' --time_window_choice=' #for $i, $j in enumerate($time_windows_cond.time_windows) $j.min,$j.max; #end for ' #else --time_window_choice='0,90;90,660;660,1230;1230,1800;' #end if --file_include=$file_include --scan_dens=$scan_dens --n=$n --snthr=$snthr --minfrac=$minfrac --polarity=$polarity --class=$class --ppm=$ppm

param.name: input
param.label: File(s) from your history containing your chromatograms
param.help: Select the dataset collection containing the files that were used for processing

param.name: sample_metadata
param.label: Sample meta-data
param.help: Metadata for each file (can re-use the sample meta-data file used for XCMS merge

param.name: class
param.label: class
param.help: XCMS class to use (default is to use the blank)

param.name: file_include
param.label: File include
param.help: Indexes of selected class to calculate topn on (comma separated string) e.g. 1,2

param.name: time_windows_choice
param.label: time-windows
param.help: Default time-windows for 30 min (1800 secs) divided as follows (secs)- 0 : 90 : 660 : 1230 : 1800

param.name: scan_dens
param.label: Scan density
param.help: for scan range x to y, take every 'n' scan (i.e. x, x+n, x+2n ... y)

param.name: n
param.label: Number of peaks to select
param.help: The number of most intense peaks to select

param.name: ppm
param.label: PPM tolerance
param.help: Parts per million tolerance for m/z between scans

param.name: minfrac
param.label: minfrac
param.help: Minimum fraction peak has to be present in windows (typically set low to catch more peaks)
